Belgium: John of Enghien, prince-bishop of Liège, dies of wounds sustained during an abduction attempt.
Indinesia: King Kertanegara launched Pabali expedition to Bali, which integrated Bali into the Singhasari territory.
Spain: Aragonese Crusade: The pope Pope Martin IV called for a crusade against Peter the Great, and declared him deposed in Aragon in favor of Charles, Count of Valois, the count of Valois. Alfonso the Wise died. He was succeeded by Sancho the Brave, though his will appointed his grandson Alfonso de la Cerda his successor in León. Battle of the Gulf of Naples: The Aragonese and Sicilian navies drew out a Neapolitan fleet in the Gulf of Naples and captured Charles of Anjou as well as some ten galleys.
Vietnam: The Diên Hồng Conference took place.
